body:
Yes, in calibration mode the engine will still have calibration_data regardless of any user provided ranges. The workflow for use_calibration=True is the same as it was before, e.g.
1. create_inference_graph() to create calibration graph
2.  send some data through the graph to calibrate
3. calib_graph_to_infer_graph() to create final inference graph

For use_calibration=False, the workflow is simply
1. create_inference_graph() to create final inference graph
body_html:
Yes, in calibration mode the engine will still have calibration_data regardless of any user provided ranges. The workflow for use_calibration=True is the same as it was before, e.g.

  1. create_inference_graph() to create calibration graph
  2. send some data through the graph to calibrate
  3. calib_graph_to_infer_graph() to create final inference graph

For use_calibration=False, the workflow is simply

  1. create_inference_graph() to create final inference graph
body_text:
Yes, in calibration mode the engine will still have calibration_data regardless of any user provided ranges. The workflow for use_calibration=True is the same as it was before, e.g.

create_inference_graph() to create calibration graph
send some data through the graph to calibrate
calib_graph_to_infer_graph() to create final inference graph

For use_calibration=False, the workflow is simply

create_inference_graph() to create final inference graph
